karriere.at7669694.description:
Lead Data Engineer / Lead Data Scientist (w/m/d)
SupplyBrain GmbH 2025-11-17  
Standort:  Graz, AT, 8020  
Zielgruppe:  Berufserfahrene  
Arbeitszeitmodell:  Vollzeit  
Beschäftigungsart:  Festanstellung  
Unternehmensbereich:  IT & Software  
Werden auch Sie Teil unserer Erfolgsgeschichte!  
Ein weltweit führender Lösungsanbieter für alle Bereiche der Intralogistik, das sind wir: SSI SCHÄFER. Was wir auch sind: Ein Familienunternehmen, das in das Know-how, die Leidenschaft und die Talente seiner Mitarbeitenden investiert.  
Als einer der größten Anbieter helfen wir unseren Kunden mit innovativen Technologien und Software die Effizienz und Nachhaltigkeit der Lager-, Kommissionier- und Transportprozesse zu steigern. Von vollautomatischen Lagern mit individuellen Service- und Wartungsangeboten bis hin zu manuellen und teilautomatisierten Systemen bieten wir wirtschaftliche Intralogistiklösungen aus einer Hand. Daneben haben wir uns zu einem der größten Anbieter für Software für den innerbetrieblichen Materialfluss entwickelt.  
SSI SCHÄFER, das sind mehr als 8.800 Menschen, die weltweit in rund 80 Gesellschaften und 7 Produktionsstätten arbeiten und Kunden aus allen Branchen mit maßgeschneiderten Intralogistiklösungen überzeugen.  
Wenn auch Sie einen attraktiven Arbeitgeber für eine langfristige Zusammenarbeit suchen, dann lernen Sie uns einfach kennen!  
Aufgaben
Wir entwickeln intelligente, datengetriebene Produkte, die reale Prozesse in der Intralogistik effizienter, transparenter und smarter machen. Dabei spielst du eine Schlüsselrolle:  

Teamwork: Du arbeitest eng mit einem interdisziplinären Team aus Entwickler:innen, Produkt- und Domänenexpert:innen zusammen, von der ersten Idee bis zum produktiven Einsatz unserer skalierbaren Datenlösungen.  
Daten mit Substanz: Du identifizierst relevante Datenquellen, entwickelst Konzepte zur Integration in unsere Datenarchitektur und treibst deren Erschließung aktiv voran.  
Von Rohdaten zu Intelligenz: Du entwickelst robuste Data Pipelines und trainierst Modelle.  
Algorithmen mit Anspruch: Du optimierst bestehende Algorithmen kontinuierlich - mit Fokus auf Performance, Stabilität und Wartbarkeit.  
Daten greifbar machen: Du machst Insights durch interaktive Dashboards und zielgerichtete Visualisierungen für Stakeholder zugänglich, um ihnen konkrete Handlungsimpulse zu liefern.  
Produktentwicklung mit Weitblick: Du gestaltest unsere datenbasierten Produkte mit - von der Architektur über das Modell bis zum Roll-out.  

Qualifikationen

Abgeschlossenes Studium in Data Science, Informatik, Statistik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation - alternativ: relevante praktische Erfahrung.  
Fundierte Kenntnisse im Data Engineering (ETL/ELT, Datenmodellierung, Pipeline-Design) und Data Cleaning bei realen, oft unvollständigen Daten.  
Erfahrung mit Zeitreihendaten, deren Besonderheiten sowie deren Modellierung und Visualisierung.  
Sehr gute Python-Skills, insbesondere im Umgang mit pandas, NumPy, matplotlib/seaborn und Jupyter Notebooks.  
Praktische Erfahrung mit Machine Learning in produktiven Umgebungen (Modell-Deployment, Monitoring, Retraining).  
Kenntnisse in Versionsverwaltung mit Git sowie idealerweise CI/CD-Workflows im ML-Kontext.  
Neugier auf Intralogistik - und Lust, mit Daten reale Probleme zu lösen, nicht nur akademische.  

Benefits

Geförderte Weiterbildung  
Flexible Arbeitszeiten  
Mitarbeiterevents  
Umfassendes Gesundheitsmanagement  
Paten Programm  
Essenszuschuss  
Home Office  
Kostenloser Parkplatz  
Business Bike Leasing  

Benefits können standortabhängig bzw. stellenbezogen variieren.  
Möglicher Eintrittstermin: ab sofort  
Wir bieten für diese Position ein monatliches Mindest-Bruttoeinstiegsgehalt von EUR4.500,00 auf Vollzeitbasis (38,5 Wochenstunden). Das tatsächliche Gehalt wird aufgrund von Vordienstzeiten, Qualifikation, Berufserfahrung und dem Kollektivvertrag berechnet.  
​​SupplyBrain GmbH  Waagner-Biro-Straße 47  8020 Graz  
Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung.   Wir fördern Chancengleichheit und richten unsere Stellenausschreibung an alle Interessierten.   Datenschutzerklärung   Für SSI SCHÄFER ist der Schutz und die Vertraulichkeit Ihrer Daten von besonderer Bedeutung. Erfahren Sie mehr dazu unter folgendem Link.

karriere.at7680380.title: Digital Content Designer and Developer (m/f/d)
karriere.at7680380.company: Boehringer Ingelheim RCV GmbH & Co KG
karriere.at7680380.snippet: Our Company At Boehringer Ingelheim we develop breakthrough therapies and innovative healthcare solutions in areas of unmet medical need for both humans and animals. As a family owned...
karriere.at7680380.description:
Our Company
At Boehringer Ingelheim we develop breakthrough therapies and innovative healthcare solutions in areas of unmet medical need for both humans and animals. As a family owned company, we focus on long-term performance. We believe that, if we have talented and ambitious people who are passionate about innovation, there is no limit to what we can achieve; after all, we started with just 28 people. Now, we are powered by 50,000 employees globally who nurture a diverse, collaborative and inclusive culture.  
Digital Content Designer and Developer (m/f/d)
Wien  
JOB-ID:
28327  
The position
As for now we are searching for a Digital Content Designer and Developer. In this role, you'll combine creativity and technology to design and manage dynamic content that enhances learning and communication for Medicine teams globally. Be part of a collaborative environment that values innovation and global reach.  
Tasks & responsibilities

Design and Develop Digital Content: Create and update engaging content for websites, SharePoint, LMP, LxP or Learning Platforms and other digital platforms to support global learning and communication.  
Produce Multimedia Learning Materials: Develop e-learning modules, videos, and other multimedia assets that enhance organizational learning and knowledge sharing.  
Collaborate Across Teams: Work closely with cross-functional teams, suppliers, and stakeholders to ensure content aligns with business needs and quality standards.  
Drive Best Practices in UX and Accessibility: Advise on and implement best practices for content design, user experience, accessibility, and usability across digital solutions.  
Manage Digital Content Projects: Oversee projects from concept to delivery, including outsourcing processes, ensuring compliance with internal standards and quality requirements.  

Requirements

Bachelor's degree in Digital Media, Graphic Design, Web Development, Communications, or a related field.  
At least 3 years' experience with multimedia content production (video editing, motion graphics, audio).  
Proficiency in design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, XD), Articulute, AI tools such as Synthesia, Hey GEN, etc., video creation and postproduction and familiarity with e-learning tools (e.g., Articulate), LMS & LxP platforms, and experience in developing and maintaining innovative learning content across digital platforms.  
Creative and innovative mindset.  
Excellent interpersonal and communicational skills combined with the ability to work both, independently and as part of a collaborative team to handle multiple projects end to end with competing deadlines in an Agile environment. Mastery of English language, both written and spoken is essential.  

Please note that employment takes place via one of our external partners. The employment takes place exclusively at Boehringer Ingelheim RCV GmbH & Co KG.  
Your Benefits

Flexible working time models: home office and flexible working hours, depending on department and position - many things are possible with us.  
Additional days off ("bridge-days"): more free time through additional days off to bridge single working days between bank holidays and the weekend - without having to use vacation days.  
Canteen & Cafeteria: whether it's coffee and croissant for breakfast, various lunch menus or snacks in between - our subsidized staff restaurant & cafeteria has something for every taste including vegetarian and vegan options.  
Learning & development: diverse training and development opportunities for your personal and professional growth. Because: you never stop learning.  
Health promotion: health is important to us - that's why we offer different programs to promote physical and mental health.  
Public transport ticket: we encourage our employees to use public transport on their daily way to work. Costs for public transport? We cover them!  

The remuneration for this position starts at EUR 59.400 gross annual target salary per year (full time). The actual salary package depends on professional experience and qualifications. We will be happy to discuss further details in person.  
We are looking forward to receiving your application online!
By uploading your application documents via our application portal, we can treat your data confidentially and in compliance with the GDPR.  
Do you have any additional questions about the position? Your HR Recruiting Manager for this position is Sławomir Popiołek.  
On our career site you will find further information about Boehringer Ingelheim as an employer as well as information about the application process and our different departments.  
Would you like to know what makes our employees special? What they tell about their motivation and their everyday work? Watch this video and hear for yourself what our colleagues have to share.  
Jetzt bewerben

karriere.at7680485.title: Forward Deployed Engineer*
karriere.at7680485.snippet: Forward Deployed Engineer* BAWAG Group is the listed holding company of BAWAG P.S.K., which is one of the largest banks in Austria with 4 million customers. As a dynamic employer...
karriere.at7680485.description:
Forward Deployed Engineer*
BAWAG Group is the listed holding company of BAWAG P.S.K., which is one of the largest banks in Austria with 4 million customers. As a dynamic employer, we promote talent and drive technological innovations quickly. Flat hierarchies, a flexible working environment and equal opportunities for our employees are particularly important to us.  
TASKS 
The ideal candidate will have strong development expertise, a solid technical background, and the ability to break down complex business and technical challenges into manageable components, apply structured problem-solving techniques, and deliver practical, scalable solutions. You should also be able to understand and influence system architecture, data flows, and compliance requirements.  
1) Solution Customization  

Deploy, customize, and integrate AI-driven solutions and workflow platforms.  
Customize and optimize solutions for performance, scalability, and compliance.  
Develop integrations with enterprise systems and third-party applications.  

2) Collaboration & Advisory  

Partner with internal product, data, and process engineering teams to ensure seamless delivery.  
Provide technical guidance and best practices for AI adoption and digital transformation.  
Drive acceleration across departments to foster innovation and adoption of advanced technologies.  

3) Operational Excellence  

Monitor and maintain deployed solutions, ensuring reliability and security.  
Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues promptly.  
Stay current with emerging technologies and recommend innovative approaches to enhance client solutions.  

PROFILE 

Proficiency in AI Foundry or similar AI platforms  
Strong programming experience in Java, Python, and C#  
Hands-on experience with Microsoft Power Platform for low-code/no-code solutions  
Expertise in Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) for container orchestration of deploying backend services  
Solid understanding of data pipeline development and management technical competencies  
Familiarity with cloud-native architectures and microservices  
Knowledge of RESTful APIs, GraphQL, and integration patterns  
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices  
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in fast-paced environments  
Understanding of data security, compliance, and governance in enterprise environments  
Preferred Qualifications Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field Certifications in Azure, AI/ML, or Power Platform  
Experience with enterprise-scale deployments  
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in fast-paced environments  
Excellent communication and presentation skills for technical and non-technical audiences  

OUR OFFER 

FlexOffice is our motto! Work in your private environment whenever it is compatible with the job. We support you with high-quality equipment and a financial allowance.  
You spend half of your working time in your home office and your office days in our modern, easily accessible office at Vienna Central Station.  
We support your personal development and career planning with an individual, attractive training program. Visit our BAWAG Academy and use our eLearning-Plattform GoodHabitz for your professional and also personal development.  
In addition, we offer interesting and lucrative additional services (company health care, group insurance, BAWAG sports club, vacation accommodation, preferential conditions for employees and their close relatives, meal subsidy).  

We guarantee a competitive salary dependent on your professional and personal qualifications, starting at EUR45.811,22 gross per year for this position, in accordance with the respective collective agreement. Salary requests above this amount will be considered depending on your previous experience and qualifications.  
Your contact person: Jutta Durstberger (+43 6648099822099) 

We value people. 

Would you like to work in a team where good cooperation and diversity are actively practiced? Then you've come to the right place. Equal opportunity is important to us - regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, physical impairment, religion or origin.  
BAWAG| Xing | LinkedIn | Facebook | Instagram 
Standort   Vienna 
Tätigkeitsbereich    Computer and Mathematics   
Wochenstunden   Vollzeit

karriere.at7680134.snippet: Kapsch TrafficCom Master's Thesis: Real-Time Traffic & Pedestrian Mapping Kapsch is one of Austria's most successful global technology companies. With its comprehensive ITS (Intelligent...
karriere.at7680134.description:
Kapsch TrafficCom
Master's Thesis: Real-Time Traffic & Pedestrian Mapping
Kapsch is one of Austria's most successful global technology companies. With its comprehensive ITS (Intelligent Transportation Systems) portfolio, Kapsch is actively addressing the challenges of the present and the future with intelligent mobility solutions in a wide range of application areas. As a family-owned company founded in 1892 and headquartered in Vienna, Kapsch can look back on 130 years of experience with the future.  
Title: Real-Time Web-Based Visualization of Vehicle and Pedestrian Detections with Trajectories on a Map Overlay  
Introduction: The increasing deployment of deep learning-based detection systems in urban environments necessitates efficient and scalable visualization solutions for vehicle and pedestrian detections. This thesis aims to develop a web-based application that visualizes real-time traffic participant detections and trajectories on a street or satellite map. The system will overlay detected positions, classifications (e.g., car, truck, bus, pedestrian, bicyclist), and trajectories on a bird's-eye or isometric view map. A key focus will be on identifying suitable map providers and visualization technologies, ensuring high performance and scalability. A prototype implementation will be developed and evaluated based on visualization efficiency, usability, and real-time performance.  
Objectives: 

Literature Review: Research existing techniques for visualizing traffic data in real-time applications.  
Technology Evaluation: Identify and compare suitable map providers (e.g., OpenStreetMap, Google Maps, Mapbox) and visualization technologies (e.g., WebGL, Three.js, Deck.gl), along with GIS frameworks.  
System Design: Develop a web-based architecture capable of handling large numbers of traffic participants in real time.  
Prototype Implementation: Build a proof-of-concept application that ingests geolocation data and displays real-time detections and trajectories.  
Performance Evaluation: Assess the system's performance in terms of rendering speed, accuracy, and scalability.  

Your Profile: 

Required Background Studies in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, Geoinformatics or related fields  
Fluent English skills  
Interest in technology  
Willingness and ability to work independently  
Excellent communication and teamwork skills  
Conscientiousness and reliability  
Strong analytical skills with a precise and structured approach  
Start: Immediately  
Duration: 3-6 months  
Successful completion of the master's thesis will be rewarded with EUR3,000.

Sie übernehmen die End-to-End-Verantwortung für die MDE-Kette im Projekt „IBA" (Analyzer, PDA, HD Server, DAT Coordinator), inklusive Systempflege, Updates und dem laufenden Betrieb (ggf. Störfall-/Fehlersuche)

karriere.at7680752.title: NGS Technician at the Biomedical Sequencing Facility (m/f/d)
karriere.at7680752.company: CeMM - FORSCHUNGSZENTRUM FÜR MOLEKULARE MEDIZIN GmbH
karriere.at7680752.snippet: The Biomedical Sequencing Facility is an academic core facility and technology platform for Next Generation Sequencing (NGS), including single-cell methods and many other assays. It...
karriere.at7680752.description:
The Biomedical Sequencing Facility is an academic core facility and technology platform for Next Generation Sequencing (NGS), including single-cell methods and many other assays. It is based at the CeMM Research Center for Molecular Medicine of the Austrian Academy of Sciences, on the campus of the Medical University of Vienna.   We are seeking a motivated and capable laboratory technician whom we will train to perform a wide range of NGS assays (genome, transcriptome, epigenome, single-cell etc.) in cancer, immunity, genetic diseases & beyond.  
NGS Technician at the Biomedical Sequencing Facility (m/f/d)
Fulltime, 40 hours per week  
Your tasks

Contribute to the swift and flawless delivery of high-quality services for all customers of the Biomedical Sequencing Facility  
Conduct a broad range of sequencing assays with high experimental rigor and accurate documentation  
Interact with and assist academic researchers using NGS in their projects (receive samples, provide advice, address problems etc.)  
Troubleshoot technical problems in sample preparation and sequencing workflows  
Contribute to day-to-day operations of the lab, including scheduling, purchasing, quality control, billing, recruitment, and accreditation  
Provide customer support, teach methods and best practices to collaborating scientists, help organize technology workshops  
Contribute to special projects such as national-scale NGS-based pathogen monitoring and the Genome of Europe initiative 
Follow and anticipate important developments in the field, identify and establish new technologies, work with pilot users  

The Biomedical Sequencing Facility   The successful candidate will be part of the Biomedical Sequencing Facility (BSF) based at CeMM. The BSF is Austria's first and leading center of expertise for next-generation sequencing in biomedicine. Under the scientific leadership of Christoph Bock and with a dedicated team of staff scientists, the BSF contributes to biomedical research and precision medicine in Vienna, Austria, and beyond. The BSF is equipped with latest technology for high-throughput genomics and powerful scientific computing infrastructure. The BSF's mandate includes a strong focus on technology development, contribution to study design and bioinformatic data analysis, as well as training and teaching best practices in sequencing technology and genomic medicine. Furthermore, it supports biomedical scientists and clinicians in the development of custom NGS protocols and in the bioinformatic analysis of the resulting datasets.   The Institute   CeMM is one of Europe's leading biomedical research institutes. It is located on the campus of the Medical University of Vienna and maintains close ties with the university. CeMM researchers publish important discoveries in top journals, which has included >15 papers in Nature/Cell/Science/NEJM and >50 papers in Nature/Science/Cell sister journals - with a team of ~150 scientists. Research at CeMM is exceptionally collaborative and has strong focus on medical impact, based on a profound molecular understanding of diseases such as cancer and immune disorders. CeMM is part of the Austrian Academy of Sciences and a founding member of EU-LIFE. It is located at the center of one of the largest medical campuses in Europe, within walking distance of Vienna's historical city center. A study by "The Scientist" put CeMM among the top-5 best places to work in academia worldwide. Vienna is frequently ranked the world's best city to live. It is a United Nations city with a large English-speaking community. The official language at CeMM is English, and >45 different nationalities are represented at the institute. CeMM promotes equal opportunity and harbors a mix of different talents, backgrounds, competences, and interests.  
Your profile

Background in molecular biology, biochemistry, biotechnology, or a related field (typically MSc degree, but BSc or PhD also considered)  
Strong wet-lab expertise and practical experience working with DNA and/or RNA  
High accuracy and reliability in execution of experiments and operating lab equipment  
Prior experience with NGS assays and/or genome sequencing instruments is a plus  
Friendly, collaborative mindset, and motivation to work in an international, interdisciplinary environment  
Team player with strong communication skills and a proactive "getting things done" mindset  
Prior work experience in an academic core facility, a clinical laboratory, or a biotech/pharma company is a plus  
Written and oral communication skills in English (German language skills are not required)  

We offer

Work within an experienced, interdisciplinary, and international team at one of Austria's leading research institutes  
Ample opportunities to contribute and gain experience in a key area of biomedical research and precision medicine  
An inspiring workplace with an international setting, strong team spirit, and an excellent work climate  
A wide range of social, cultural, and sports activities organized by the institute  
Excellent employee benefits including full insurance coverage (health, accident, retirement), health care services, subsidized cafeteria  
Minimum starting annual gross salary of EUR 39.000 (the salary will reflect the successful candidate's qualifications)  
Flexible start date. Open-ended full-time contacts are available after an initial trial period. Support for relocating to Vienna is provided.  
Normal working week is 40 hours. Core working time is the working time during which the employee must be present at the workplace. Monday to Thursday from 09:00 to 15:00 and Friday from 09:00 to 13:00. A maximum of 1 home office day per calendar week may be used.  
This role is based in Vienna, Austria.  

Apply now 
Applications details
Please apply online with cover letter, CV, academic transcripts, and contact details of three referees (if available). Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. Any application received by 31 December 2025 will be considered.   City: Vienna  Position type: Full-time  Start of work: TBD  Responsible: Memo Mokhles

Du designst Abbildungssysteme mit sequenziellem Raytracing in Zemax  
Zur Sicherstellung der Fertigbarkeit von Optiken führst du Sensitivitäts- und Toleranzanalysen durch  
Du stehst in enger Zusammenarbeit mit Kunden und dem Vertrieb im Zuge des Requirements- und Risk-Managements  
Du führst eine normkonforme Dokumentation des Entwicklungsprozesses und der Ergebnisse  
Du recherchierst zu Lichtquellen und optischen Komponenten  
Du führst bei den Prototypen den Aufbau und die Verifikation durch  
Du begleitest bei unseren Kunden die Verifizierungs- und Validierungstests sowie bei akkreditierten Stellen

Erfolgreich abgeschlossene technische Ausbildung (FH, Universität) im Bereich Mathematik, Physik, Optik oder vergleichbares  
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung von Vorteil  
Idealerweise bringst du Erfahrung in Tools zur Optiksimulation mit wie Zermax etc.  
Du verfügst über Programmierkenntnisse wie Python und bringst praktische Erfahrung am optischen Tisch mit  
Kenntnisse und Anwendungen von einschlägigen Normen wie IEC 62471, IEC 60825-1 etc. sind von Vorteil  
Ein strukturierter und analytischer Arbeitsstil zeichnet dich aus sowie gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift  

WORAUF DU DICH BEI UNS IN DER WILD GRUPPE FREUEN KANNST:

Über Frequentis
Frequentis Group mit Headquarter in Wien ist ein internationaler Anbieter von Kommunikations- und Informationssystemen für Leitzentralen mit sicherheitskritischen Aufgaben. Weltweit vertrauen bereits über 500 Kunden in rund 150 Ländern mit mehr als 45.000 Arbeitsplätzen unserem Know-how und langjähriger Erfahrung.  
Unser strategisches Geschäftsfeld Defence bietet Kunden Systeme und Lösungen für Flugsicherungs- und Luftverteidigungsanwendungen als auch für zivile Katastrophenschutzsysteme.  
Aufgaben

Implementierung und Wartung von Automatisierungslösungen in verschiedenen Systemumgebungen  
(Weiter-)Entwicklung oder Anpassung von Softwaretools und Skripten zur Optimierung von Systembetrieb und Lieferleistung  
Bereitstellung von automatisierten Lösungen zur Integration von internen Produkten und third-party Komponenten  
Effiziente Fehleranalyse und Behebung von Problemen bei Implementierungen  
Intensive Zusammenarbeit mit Teammitgliedern und relevanten Stakeholdern zur Verbesserung von Systemdesign, Skalierbarkeit und Wartbarkeit  
Kontinuierliche Optimierung der erstellten Lösungen, Tools und Prozessen  
Erstellung von Dokumentationen sowie Durchführung von Wissenstransfer und Schulungen bei Bedarf  

Qualifikationen

Abgeschlossene technische Ausbildung mit Schwerpunkt IT oder Informatik  
Mindestens 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung im Bereich DevOps, Systemadministration oder Softwareentwicklung  
Erfahrung mit Infrastructure-as-Code- und Konfigurationsmanagement-Tools (z. B. Ansible, Terraform)  
Fundierte Kenntnisse in Automatisierung und Scripting (z. B. Python, Bash, PowerShell)  
Gute Kenntnisse von Betriebssystemen (z. B. RedHat, Windows) sowie IT-Infrastruktur (z. B. Virtualisierung, Container-Technologien)  
Vertrautheit mit System-Lifecycle-Management und Anforderungsanalyse  
Ausgeprägte Fähigkeit zur Priorisierung von Aufgaben und effizientem Zeitmanagement  
Selbstorganisierte, proaktive und strukturierte Arbeitsweise  
Reisebereitschaft 15-20%

karriere.at7680509.description:
IDM Senior Developer (f/m/x)
Are you a seasoned IDM Developer with a passion for Identity and Access Management (IAM)? Join RBI and be at the forefront of digital security innovation.  We operate a highly integrated and customized Identity Management (IDM) system based on One Identity Manager. Our IDM team ensures secure, efficient, and scalable identity and access management across the organization. The team includes Product Owner, Business Analyst, Architect, Lead Tester, and Lead Operations specialist.  We are looking for a Senior Developer to join this collaborative environment and help us maintain and evolve this critical platform.  
Your mission at RBI

Design, develop, and maintain custom workflows, processes, and connectors within One Identity Manager.  
Integrate IDM with enterprise systems (HR, Active Directory, cloud services, and business applications).  
Analyze and optimize existing IDM configurations and customizations for performance and scalability.  
Implement security and compliance standards within IDM solutions.  
Collaborate closely with team members:  
Work with Business Analysts to translate business requirements into technical solutions.  
Coordinate with the Architect on system design and integration strategies.  
Support the Lead Tester during test planning and execution.  
Partner with Lead Operations to ensure smooth deployment and operational stability.  
Participate in upgrade projects and roadmap planning for future IDM enhancements.  
Mentor junior developers and contribute to best practices and coding standards.  

Your Core Competencies

Deep expertise in One Identity Manager (design, configuration, and customization).  
Strong programming skills in languages commonly used with IDM (e.g., C#, .NET, PowerShell).  
Experience with database technologies (MS SQL Server) and writing complex queries.  
Solid understanding of identity and access management principles, including RBAC, provisioning, and governance.  
Integration experience with directories (Active Directory, LDAP), cloud platforms (Azure AD), and enterprise applications.  
Experience with modern web technologies, specifically Angular, for front-end development  
Excellent collaboration and communication skills for working with technical and non-technical stakeholders.  

What's in it for you:

Flexible work week: Flexible hours, work-from-home options from Austria, and 30 days/year remote work from any EU country.  
Global community: 75+ nationalities, English as the company language, and work permit support. Find out more about international applications here.  
Career growth: We believe in continuous learning and proactive career development. Take on challenging work that stretches your abilities, attend trainings, and use new technologies to make a lasting impact.  
Stay healthy: Subsidized canteen, well-being programs, check-ups, and sport allowances.  
Save money: Discounts, exclusive banking terms, and a heavily subsidized public transport pass.  
Family support: Child allowances, gender-neutral parental leave, bilingual company kindergarten, and holiday childcare.  
Competitive salary: Starting at EUR 60.000, gross p.a. including overtime, with market-compliant overpayment based on experience and qualifications. We are happy to discuss your actual salary in person.  

For questions regarding our application process, please feel free to take a look on our website or check out our FAQ.   Your contact:  Johannes Stadler  Talent Acquisition Team  
At Raiffeisen Bank International, we are pleased to have more than 17 million customers in Austria and 12 other CEE countries - what got us here, are our talented people. From the moment you join RBI, you will notice our commitment to creating a working environment where everyone can thrive. Diversity and inclusion are essential components of our vision and mission and are reflected in our values: collaboration, proactivity, learning and responsibility. Our shared mission is to provide a superior customer experience by tackling new issues such as digitalization and changing needs.  
Your benefits at one sight:
Join a team that values your well-being and professional development, offering a varienty of benefits to support your success. To learn more about the benefits, hover over the icon.  

We offer public transport benefits for commuters within and outside of Vienna - for instance, we sponsor the Wiener Linien annual ticket.  
Our staff restaurants offers a wide variety of meal options with a strong focus on healthy and organic food, vegetarian and vegan options included. And the prices are heavily subsidized.  
Benefit from numerous subsidies and discounts for cultural events and in the sports sector, e.g. subsidies for concert tickets or fitness centers.  
As an integral component of our company's DNA, we provide internal learning and growth opportunities, allowing for advancement within our organization.  
We offer flexible working hours without a core time requirement, as well as extensive hybrid work options. Additionally, employees are entitled to 30 days per year of remote work from any EU country outside Austria.  
Recognizing the significance of family to our employees, we provide family allowances, gender-neutral parental leave, a bilingual company kindergarten, and childcare during holidays.  

Apply now »

Staff Engineer Statistics Projects (f/m/div)
#WeAreIn for jobs that impact everyone's life. What if your ideas could change the way the world connects, powers up, or thinks? As a Staff Engineer Statistics Projects on our Research & Development team, you'll have the opportunity to merge creativity with your technical expertise by shaping the future of technology, driving groundbreaking projects, and bringing new ideas to life. Are you in?  
Your Role 
Key responsibilities in your new role  
In your new role, you are part of an international automotive engineering team at our site in Villach.  

Support research work on statistical topics in semiconductor design and manufacturing 
Drive automotive innovation topics and support funding opportunities    
Take over the technical lead role within internationally funded projects 
Be responsible for the project reporting 
Maintain and develop statistical tools

5+ years professional working experience in technical area  
Experience in automotive and/or semiconductor industry  
Strong theoretical mathematical background and publication record 
Programming skills (Matlab, R, etc.)  
Willingness to travel  
Excellent English skills, German optional  

We offer competitive salaries and additional benefits based on your performance, experience and qualification. karriere.at7679819.description:
Wir sind eine national bzw. überwiegend im deutschsprachigen Raum tätige und renommierte Ingenieurgesellschaft mit den Schwerpunkten unterirdisches Bauen, konstruktiver Ingenieurbau, Geotechnik/Bodenmechanik, Wasserbau und Wasserwirtschaft. Zum baldigen Eintritt suchen wir am Standort Wien eine(n):  
Senior Ingenieur:in im Tunnelbau / Tiefbau / Wasserbau (m/w/d)
mit mindestens 8 Jahren Berufserfahrung in der Planung entsprechender Bauvorhaben in den Bereichen Infrastruktur, Geotechnik / Spezialtiefbau und / oder Energieerzeugung.   Ihr zukünftiges Aufgabengebiet umfasst die eigenverantwortliche technische Planung vorwiegend in anspruchsvollen Projekten des Tunnel- und Stollenbaus sowie des konstruktiven Wasserbaus in allen Projektphasen, insbesondere auch im Rahmen von Großprojekten. Dabei obliegt Ihnen überdies die Koordination und Abstimmung mit der zugehörigen statisch-konstruktiven Bearbeitung sowie die Leitung über die Planerstellung durch unser Team an Technischen Zeichnern und Konstrukteuren.   Wir wenden uns an Personen mit einem abgeschlossenen Universitäts- oder Fachhochschulstudium im Bereich Bauingenieurwesen oder Kulturtechnik und Wasserwirtschaft mit nachgewiesener einschlägiger Projekterfahrung, Leidenschaft in der Entwicklung technischer Lösungen und Interesse an der Mitwirkung bei bedeutsamen und innovativen Projekten. Je nach Wunsch und persönlicher Entwicklung besteht für Sie perspektivisch auch die Möglichkeit der Übernahme der Projektleitung.   Gemäß Kollektivvertrag beträgt das Jahresgehalt für diese Stelle mind. ca. EUR 52.000 brutto (bei Vollzeit). Die tatsächliche Entlohnung liegt deutlich über diesem Wert und richtet sich nach Ihrer vorhandenen Qualifikation und Erfahrung.   Wenn Sie sich von dieser Aufgabe angesprochen fühlen, erwarten wir gerne Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen per smart bewerben oder unter der Adresse  
Geoconsult Wien ZT GmbH  Hütteldorfer Straße 85  1150 Wien  www.geoconsult.at

karriere.at10005570.title: Software Test Engineer
karriere.at10005570.description:
As part of our QA team, you'll help accelerate delivery and improve the quality of Altova products used by thousands of customers worldwide. You'll work closely with our development and support teams and be actively involved in test planning, execution, and automation.  
Software Test Engineer
Full-Time (38,5 h/W)
Your Responsibilities

Prepare and maintain test plans and test cases  
Execute manual and automated test suites and review the results  
Automate test cases  
Document issues and report bugs in our defect tracking system  
Verify and re-test issues fixed by the development team  

Your Profile
Must-have: 

Professional experience in software testing (ideally MS Windows applications)  
Basic knowledge of shell scripting  
Basic knowledge of Linux operating systems  
Strong interpersonal skills and a collaborative mindset  
Good English skills, both written and spoken  

Nice-to-have: 

Knowledge of Node.js  
Experience with WebdriverIO  
Experience with Eclipse and Microsoft Visual Studio  
Experience with Mobile Apps  
Basic knowledge of C++  
Basic knowledge of SQL and relational databases (ideally MS SQL Server, Oracle, or IBM DB2) and non-SQL databases (MongoDB, CouchDB)  
Basic knowledge of macOS  

What We Offer:

An office in Vienna's first district with excellent infrastructure  
Easy access by public transport - we provide a Wiener Linien (core zone) transport pass  
A highly professional, flexible, and casual working environment (including flexible working hours)  

Salary
The collective agreement minimum salary is 3,175 EUR gross per month (on a 38.5-hour basis). The actual salary amounts to 3,300 EUR gross per month or higher depending on your professional experience (on a 38.5-hour basis). The salary is paid 14 times per year. The collective agreement Informationstechnologie, Datenverarbeitung (IT) applies.  
Overtime
Any accrued overtime is compensated in the form of time off.  
If you enjoy working in a professional but relaxed atmosphere and want to help shape the quality of leading developer tools, we'd love to hear from you.  
Please send your CV and  

a brief cover letter explaining how you meet the above criteria and how your previous experience will help you succeed as a Software Test Engineer at Altova.  
Confirmation of your legal permission to work in Austria (if you are not EU citizen).  

We look forward to hearing from you!

karriere.at7680482.title: Business Process Engineer*
karriere.at7680482.snippet: Business Process Engineer* BAWAG Group is the listed holding company of BAWAG P.S.K., which is one of the largest banks in Austria with 4 million customers. As a dynamic employer...
karriere.at7680482.description:
Business Process Engineer*
BAWAG Group is the listed holding company of BAWAG P.S.K., which is one of the largest banks in Austria with 4 million customers. As a dynamic employer, we promote talent and drive technological innovations quickly. Flat hierarchies, a flexible working environment and equal opportunities for our employees are particularly important to us.  
TASKS 

Analyze and document end-to-end business processes, identifying inefficiencies, dependencies, and improvement opportunities.  
Responsible to break down complex business and technical challenges/projects into manageable components, apply structured problem-solving techniques, and deliver practical, scalable solutions.  
Act as a bridge between business and technology, translating operational and regulatory requirements into actionable technical specifications.  
Understand and interpret second-line requirements from Compliance, AML, Tax, FATCA, and other regulatory functions, and translate them into clear business and system requirements.  
Lead and execute process improvement initiatives, applying Lean and Six Sigma principles.  
Create and maintain process diagrams  
Identify process pain points and develop strategic, data-driven solutions.  
Connect the dots between processes, systems, and data, ensuring alignment and traceability.  
Perform data analysis and build dashboards using Power BI to support decision-making and performance tracking.  
Work with low-code platforms like Microsoft Power Platform to prototype and implement process solutions.  
Stay informed on emerging technologies such as AI, autonomous AI agents, and Copilots, and assess their impact on business processes.  
Collaborate cross-functionally to drive organizational change, ensuring stakeholder alignment and adoption.  
Communicate effectively across teams, fostering a culture of transparency, innovation, and continuous improvement.  

PROFILE 

Proven experience in business process engineering or process improvement, with a track record of successful initiative execution.  
Strong technical background with the ability to understand and influence system architecture, data flows, and compliance requirements.  
Proficiency in process modeling tools Hands-on experience with Power BI and Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate).  
Familiarity with Lean, Six Sigma Continuous Improvement (Kaizen) techniques.  
Understanding of AI technologies, including autonomous agents and Copilot integrations.  
Excellent analytical thinking, problem-solving, and strategic planning skills.  
Strong communication and interpersonal skills; a collaborative team player.  
Flexible and resilient, with the ability to drive change in complex environment.  
Ability to break down complex business and technical challenges into manageable components, apply structured problem-solving techniques, and deliver practical, scalable solutions.  
Stakeholder Management (cross department and cross country).  
Strong project management and execution skills.  

OUR OFFER 

You spend 50% of your working days in our modern office, easily accessible office at Vienna Central Station. Here you can also place your little ones in the company's own kindergarten, which is run by the Wiener Kinderfreunde.  
We support your personal development and career planning with an individual, attractive training program. Visit our BAWAG Academy and use our eLearning-Plattform GoodHabitz for your professional and also personal development.  
In addition, we offer interesting and lucrative additional services (company health care, group insurance, BAWAG sports club, vacation accommodation, preferential conditions for employees and their close relatives, meal subsidy).  

We guarantee a competitive salary dependent on your professional and personal qualifications, starting at EUR 45.811,22 gross per year for this position, in accordance with the respective collective agreement. Salary requests above this amount will be considered depending on your previous experience and qualifications.  
Your contact person: Jutta Durstberger (+43 6648099822099) 

We value people. 

Would you like to work in a team where good cooperation and diversity are actively practiced? Then you've come to the right place. Equal opportunity is important to us - regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, physical impairment, religion or origin.  
BAWAG| Xing | LinkedIn | Facebook | Instagram

Reference nr.: JN -112025-6884118

About Our Client
Our client is an internationally established high-tech manufacturer developing sophisticated industrial machinery and engineered systems for global customers. The company stands for innovation, precision, and long-term engineering excellence, offering a modern work environment and strong professional development programs.  
As an Electrical Design Engineer, you will drive the electrical design of complete systems, work closely with software, mechanical design, production, and purchasing, and contribute to the delivery of complex, safety-critical, and technologically advanced equipment.  
The position is based in the city of Salzburg.

Design and creation of electrical circuit diagrams and parts lists using EPLAN P8 (ideally also EPLAN Cogineer)  
Participation in the development and planning of complete electrotechnical systems  
Revision, review, and continuous improvement of existing circuit diagrams and documentation  
Preparation of technical schedules, specifications, and procurement information for suppliers  
Selection of sensors and components based on fluid and process plans  
Calculation of electrical loads and system power requirements  
Cross-functional collaboration with software engineering, mechanical design, purchasing, and production  
Technical support throughout design, build, and commissioning phases  

The Successful Applicant

Completed technical education in Electrical Engineering, Automation Technology, Mechatronics or a related discipline (HTL, FH, University)  
Practical experience with EPLAN P8 or comparable CAE systems (WSCAD, AutoCAD Electrical, Zuken, etc.)  
Professional experience in electrical design or engineering preferred  
Strong analytical thinking and solution-oriented approach  
High sense of responsibility, precision, and technical curiosity  
Excellent English skills; German is beneficial but not required  
Team-oriented mindset and strong communication skills  

What`s on Offer

Minimum annual salary: approx. EUR70,000, depending on experience (higher packages possible for senior profiles)  
10% annual bonus  
Generous paid leave policies for parents  
Participation in company-wide share programs  
2 days of home office per week  
Relocation package for candidates moving from abroad or other regions of Austria  
Comprehensive benefits program and modern workplace infrastructure  

Contact
We are looking forward to receiving your application stating your salary expectations as well as the reference number JN -112025-6884118. Your application will be forwarded to the consultant in charge. Please note: We are accepting online applications only in order to ensure a fast processing.

karriere.at7679108.description:
Software Quality Engineering & Test Automation (ab 32h)

Voll- oder Teilzeit  
Hybrid  
Linz, Österreich  
Mit Berufserfahrung  
 14.11.25  

Über uns
Axians ICT Austria GmbH arbeitet in strategischen Partnerschaften in der IT-Dienstleistung mit über 30 Jahren Erfahrung. Im Bereich Business Applications bieten wir Lösungen von Hardware und Infrastruktur über eigene Software Entwicklungen bis hin zur Analyse und Visualisierung von Daten und KPI's. Unsere Business Unit cargoNET entwickelt eine Komplettlösung für Kurier- und Express Paketdienste. Von den administrativen Prozessen, über die Kernapplikation, den Webservices/Applikationen bis zur Lösung für die mobilen Erfassungsgeräte wird unseren Kunden eine moderne und performante SaaS Lösung zur Verfügung gestellt.  
Das Team Softwareentwicklung sucht Unterstützung für einen attraktiven und vielfältigen Job in Linz:  
Deine Mission

Verantwortung für die Qualitätssicherung unserer Applikationen  
Entwicklung und Pflege von robusten und smarten automatisierten Tests für Webservices, .NET und Android Applikationen  
Weiterentwicklung und Wartung der Testinfrastruktur mit dem Ziel, eine qualitativ hochwertige Basis für unsere Produkte zu schaffen  
Sicherstellung der Zuverlässigkeit und Performance unserer Applikationen auf höchstem Niveau  
Aktive Mitgestaltung rund um Testmanagement, Testplanung und -durchführung  

Das macht dich besonders

Du unterstützt uns mit deiner Erfahrung in der Qualitätssicherung bzw. im Software Testing.  
Idealerweise hast du schon im Umfeld C# .NET, SoapUI, FlaUI und Appium Berührungspunkte.  
Du bringst einen IT-Background (z.B. HTL, FH, Uni) mit.  
Du sprichst und schreibst fließend Deutsch und gut Englisch.  
Dein Arbeitsstil ist genau, proaktiv und eigenverantwortlich.  

Das bieten wir dir

Flexible Arbeitszeitgestaltung: gestalte deine Arbeitszeit nach deinen Bedürfnissen- mit Gleitzeit ohne Kernzeit, Teilzeit-, Home-Office-Möglichkeit - und finde deine Balance zwischen Familie, Freizeit und Weiterbildung  
Attraktive Benefits: genieße Essens- und Mobilitätszuschüsse, Jobrad, die Möglichkeit zu Workation und eine extra Urlaubstag bei Geburt deines Kindes  
Umfassende Gesundheitsangebote: nutze unsere vielfältigen Gesundheitsangebote wie Vorsorgeuntersuchungen, Resilienz Workshops, kostenfreier Zugang zu Instahelp u.v.m.  
Welcome im #TeamAxians: dein Buddy unterstützt, vernetzt und begleitet dich vom ersten Tag an und hilft dir deinen Platz bei uns zu finden  
Vielfältige Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten & Vernetzung: profitiere von unserer VINCI Academy, Mentoring Programmen und Netzwerktreffen, um dich fachlich und persönlich weiterzuentwickeln  
Gemeinsame Aktivitäten und Events: feiere gemeinsam mit uns große und kleine Erfolge bei Weihnachtsfeiern, Sommerfesten, Teamevents und genieße die Teilnahme an sportlichen Events  

Für diese Beschäftigung gilt ein monatliches Bruttogehalt iHv 4.000,- Euro (Vollzeitbasis) und je nach Qualifikation bzw. Erfahrung bieten wir eine entsprechende Überzahlung.  
Haben wir dein Interesse geweckt? 
Martina Asenbaum freut sich auf deine Bewerbungsunterlagen!  
Solltest du nicht alle Anforderungen erfüllen, jedoch motiviert sein, Teil des #TeamAxians zu werden, bewirb' dich trotzdem gerne und überzeuge uns mit deiner Motivation und Persönlichkeit.  
Wir bei Axians leben, fördern und schätzen die Vielfalt, somit freuen wir uns über alle Bewerbungen - unabhängig von Geschlecht, Alter, Herkunft, sexueller Orientierung, Religionszugehörigkeit oder Beeinträchtigung.  
Wir sind stets bestrebt ein noch inklusiverer Arbeitgeber zu sein und möchten Menschen mit Beeinträchtigungen ausdrücklich ermutigen, sich zu bewerben. Falls du Fragen dazu hast, melde Dich gerne bei unserer Inklusionsbeauftragten Ingrid Weinzettl (per Telefon/ Chat/ Video unter+436648513705 oder per Mail: ingrid.weinzettl@axians.at)  
Das Mitsenden eines Fotos kann gerne ausbleiben, da wir uns ohnehin einen persönlichen Eindruck verschaffen möchten.  
Ansprechpartner
Martina Asenbaum  
 Online bewerben

karriere.at7679513.title: Senior Process & Data Expert (w/m/d) - Supply Chain Management
karriere.at7679513.snippet: Your tasks: Develop the global strategy for processes and data in collaboration with the Senior Process Manager for the focus areas Supply Planning and Inventory management, Ensure standardized data collection...
karriere.at7679513.description:
At PALFINGER, we have been lifting goods to a new level for over 90 years - with a pioneering and passionate spirit. As a global technology and engineering company, we are the world's leading manufacturer and supplier of innovative crane and lifting solutions. Our success is based on the tireless efforts of our approximately 12,350 employees, who contribute their ideas and energy to our vision. With us, you can expect a dynamic working environment full of opportunities for personal and professional development. Become part of our team and start your career at PALFINGER.  
Senior Process & Data Expert (w/m/d) - Supply Chain Management
We are looking for a Senior Process & Data Expert (w/m/d) to help shape the future of our supply chain operations. In this role, you will drive global strategies for processes and data, ensuring standardization, efficiency, and knowledge sharing across regions. If you have a strong analytical mindset, expertise in ERP systems (preferably SAP), and a passion for designing and implementing innovative processes, this is your opportunity to make a real impact.  
Bring your experience in Supply Chain Management and your hands-on approach to a dynamic, international environment where your ideas matter.  
YOUR TASKS:    

Develop the global strategy for processes and data in collaboration with the Senior Process Manager for the focus areas Supply Planning and Inventory management  
Ensure standardized data collection, data handling and system entry to allow for a focus on decision making  
Ensure knowledge build up and sharing across regions & sites (e.g., concept behind safety/cycle stock, inventory drivers, constrained vs. unconstrained demand)  
Design and maintain standardized inventory monitoring and escalation governance  
Lead process modeling, documentation, and training of local experts during rollouts  

YOUR QUALIFICATIONS:    

Academic degree or proven track record in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, Industrial Engineering, or related field

Working with us means believing in the future; in the great people who are shaping it together every day and in the wide-ranging career paths it opens up. #believeinyourself

Erste Group was founded in 1819 as the first Austrian savings bank and today it is one of the largest banking groups in Central and Eastern Europe (CEE). As an attractive employer, Erste Group offers interesting career opportunities in an international environment.  
The Group Retail Transformation department at Erste Group focuses on developing and transforming the group-wide retail business. This involves designing and implementing a future-oriented retail business model with a strong emphasis on innovation, digitalization, while consistently delivering an outstanding customer experience and ensuring business profitability.  
Your Tasks:

Support data analysis and reporting for retail transformation initiatives across multiple markets.  
Assist in preparing dashboards and visualizations to monitor KPIs and project progress.  
Contribute to data quality checks and documentation for group-wide retail projects.  
Research and compile insights on customer behavior and digital trends to support decision-making.  

Your Background:

Ongoing studies in Business Administration, Economics, Data Science, or related fields.  
Strong analytical skills and proficiency in MS Excel; knowledge of SQL or BI tools (e.g., Power BI) is a plus.  
Interest in retail banking, digital transformation, and data-driven decision-making.  
Good communication skills in English (German is an advantage) and ability to work in an international team.  

Our Offer:

Exciting and challenging internship for 6 months part-time (19.25h/week) as of February/ March 2026.  
Support of your professional and personal development in a dynamic, comprehensive and interesting area.  
We guarantee an internship allowance of minimum EUR 2.660,50 gross per month on a full-time basis (except obligatory internships) and benefits of Erste Group.  
We consider the diversity of our employees as key to innovation and success. As employer we are proud to offer everyone equal chances, irrespective of age, skin colour, religious belief, gender, sexual orientation or origin.

Nina Fischl

Dass die voestalpine heute ein führender Stahl- und Technologiekonzern ist, verdankt sie vor allem den rund 49.700 Mitarbeitenden. Wir arbeiten permanent an einem modernen Arbeitsumfeld, das Vielfalt, Chancengleichheit und Freude an Innovationen wertschätzt. Wir freuen uns auf Ihre

Das sind wir
voestalpine Signaling Austria GmbH, unsere Niederlassung in Zeltweg ist spezialisiert auf Antriebs-, Verschluss- & Überwachungseinrichtungen. Hier entwickeln wir einzeln kombinierbare Produkte sowie komplette Systemlösungen in Verbindung mit innovativen Kraftübertragungssystemen. Außerdem liegt im Geschäftsbereich „Diagnostic and Monitoring Technologies" (DMT) unsere Kernkompetenz in der Überwachung von ortsfesten Anlagen. Wir bieten unseren Kund:innen innovative Überwachungslösungen und Werkzeuge, die sie dabei unterstützen, intelligente Wartungspraktiken zu implementieren und Anlagenausfälle effektiv zu vermeiden. karriere.at10005603.title: PHP Software Engineer (m/f/d)
karriere.at10005603.description:
About IXOPAY   Our mission at IXOPAY is to secure and optimize payments for global commerce. We're building an integrated platform that optimizes payment transactions and protects payments data. For merchants who understand that payments are now a strategic function, IXOPAY is a complete payments optimization platform that delivers best-in-class tokenization and transaction routing. Unlike point solutions, IXOPAY delivers omnichannel tokenization, card lifecycle management, and smart routing via any payments service provider -- giving merchants unprecedented control over their revenue and the competitive edge to thrive in global commerce.   We believe our people are our most valuable asset and that our culture is defined by our core values that align the organization with our mission and strategy. As a Software Engineer, you will play an important role in contributing to the team's goals. You will be working alongside a team of experienced engineers in a fast-paced, collaborative environment to design, develop, and test new features that enhance our product's capabilities and user experience for our customers. This is an excellent opportunity to further develop your skills while making a tangible impact on IXOPAY's product offerings.  
PHP Software Engineer (m/f/d)
Position Responsibilities

Deliver high performance software solutions using established software architecture patterns and best practices in PHP  
Design, develop, document, and deploy features and applications in our datacenters and cloud environments  
Ensure application security, performance, uptime, and scalability  
Collaborate with the Product Management team and Engineering leadership on new features and functionality  
Demonstrate an ongoing passion for learning and improving the IXOPAY platform, the payment markets, and client use cases  
Maintain and evolve our infrastructure to support the growing volume of products, APIs and integrations.  

Requirements

Several years of professional experience in software development with PHP and common PHP frameworks (e.g., Laravel, Symfony, Doctrine)  
Solid knowledge in web technologies and relational and non-relational databases  
Very good English skills, comfortable with consuming and writing API documentation  
General knowledge of distributed systems, complex APIs and API design  
Can design software components for scalability, testability, supportability and maintainability  
Can balance attention to detail and pragmatic approaches as applicable  
Understands the product and software development process and tooling (preferably Agile).  

What We'll Offer:

A critical support role in enterprise sales with direct exposure to high-profile deals  
Collaboration with senior leadership and cross-functional international teams  
Hybrid working setup with flexibility and autonomy  
A dynamic and fast-growing Fintech environment with strong career development potential  
Annual ticket for Wiener Linien public transport  
Free coffee, tea, and fruit  
IXO Fitness: All employees have automatic and free access to numerous fitness centers and sports activities via the myClubs app  
Numerous team and company events also ensure variety in our everyday work  

Salary
The collective agreement minimum salary is 3,843 EUR gross per month (on a 38.5-hour basis). The salary is paid 14 times per year. The collective agreement Informationstechnologie, Datenverarbeitung (IT) applies. The actual salary will be discussed in the interview process and is market level pay above the CLA.  
Overtime
Any accrued overtime is partially compensated in the form of time off and partially paid out.

karriere.at7680020.title: Java Backend Developer
karriere.at7680020.snippet: Java Backend Developer BAWAG Group is the listed holding company of BAWAG P.S.K., which is one of the largest banks in Austria with 4 million customers. As a dynamic employer, we promote...
karriere.at7680020.description:
Java Backend Developer
BAWAG Group is the listed holding company of BAWAG P.S.K., which is one of the largest banks in Austria with 4 million customers. As a dynamic employer, we promote talent and drive technological innovations quickly. Flat hierarchies, a flexible working environment and equal opportunities for our employees are particularly important to us.  
What You'll Be Doing 

Writing great code: You'll design, develop, and manage software that's clean, efficient, and makes a real impact.  
Shaping the future: Help define architecture and governance processes to ensure everything runs smoothly and securely.  
Leading technically: Offer your expertise to guide project teams and build reusable frameworks that make development easier for everyone.  
Solving problems: When production issues come up, you'll jump in and figure out the best solutions quickly.  
Analyzing & improving: Get to know existing programs and components, and find ways to make them better.  
Collaborating across teams: Work with BA, QA, and DevOps teams to ensure smooth rollouts in test and production environments.  
Taking ownership: You'll be the driver of continuous improvements in both quality and security, not just in your team but across the company.  

What We're Looking For 

Java and Spring expert: You've got solid programming experience (minimum 5 years) in Java, JSF, Spring, Spring Boot, and Spring Cloud frameworks.  
API guru: You know REST APIs inside and out and can build stable, secure endpoints.  
Cloud and Docker experience: You're familiar with cloud platforms and Docker, essential for modern development.  
Automation enthusiast: You're comfortable with tools like Maven/Gradle, Jenkins, and PostgreSQL, ensuring your code gets deployed efficiently.  
Strong design skills: You're good at creating clear documentation and designing technical solutions.  
Independent and team-focused: You're self-motivated but know when to collaborate to get the best results.  
Experienced developer: You've completed your education in software development, whether through university or a technical program.  
Detail-oriented thinker: You're logical, structured, and always pay attention to the finer details.  
Bilingual is a plus: You have strong English skills, and if you're fluent in German, that's a big bonus!  

OUR OFFER 

FlexOffice is our motto! Work in your private environment whenever it is compatible with the job. We support you with high-quality equipment and a financial allowance.  
You spend your office days (2,5) in our modern, easily accessible office at Vienna Central Station. Here you can also place your little ones in the company's own kindergarten.  
We support your personal development and career planning with an individual, attractive training program. Visit our BAWAG Academy and use our eLearning-Plattform GoodHabitz for your professional and also personal development.  
In addition, we offer interesting and lucrative additional services (company health care, group insurance, BAWAG sports club, vacation accommodation, preferential conditions for employees and their close relatives, meal subsidy).  

We guarantee a competitive salary dependent on your professional and personal qualifications, starting at EUR 45.811,22 gross per year for this position, in accordance with the respective collective agreement. Salary requests above this amount will be considered depending on your previous experience and qualifications.  
Your contact person: Jutta Durstberger (+43) 6648099822099 

We value people. 

Would you like to work in a team where good cooperation and diversity are actively practiced? Then you've come to the right place. Equal opportunity is important to us - regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, physical impairment, religion or origin.  
BAWAG| Xing | LinkedIn | Facebook | Instagram

karriere.at10005569.title: Lecturer/Wissenschaftliche*r Mitarbeiter*in im Institut für Wirtschaftsinformatik & Informationstechnologie
karriere.at10005569.description:
Lust auf Lehre, die Leben verändert - auch deins? 
Du willst dein IT-Wissen nicht nur anwenden, sondern weitergeben? Du hast Lust auf Mitgestaltungsmöglichkeiten und ein flexibles Arbeitsmodell? 
Vielleicht bist du aus der IT-Branche, aus der Lehre und Forschung, am Wiedereinstieg oder ein*e erfahrene*r Lernbegleiter*in - bei uns zählt, was du einbringst, nicht, ob dein Lebenslauf dem Standard entspricht. Wenn du gerne mit Studierenden arbeitest, dich für digitale Bildung und Chancengleichheit begeisterst und ein offenes, modernes Umfeld suchst, dann bist du bei uns genau richtig.  
Lecturer/Wissenschaftliche*r Mitarbeiter*in im Institut für Wirtschaftsinformatik & Informationstechnologie
Was du bei uns machst:

Du lehrst im BA- und MA-Studium und betreust Studierende bei ihren Abschlussarbeiten in den Bereichen  
Business Intelligence  
Emerging Technologies  
Wirtschaftliche, gesellschaftliche und ethische Fragen der Wirtschaftsinformatik  
Zukunftsthemen, von denen wir heute noch nicht einmal die Namen kennen  
Du wirkst an der Konzeption neuer Bildungselemente und Lehrformen mit.  
Du betreibst deine eigene wissenschaftliche Weiterqualifikation (Publikationen und Konferenzteilnahmen).  
Du arbeitest an organisatorischen Aufgaben rund um die Lehre mit.  

Du passt zu uns, wenn....

…du ein abgeschlossenes Master- oder Diplomstudium in einem Wirtschaftsinformatik-orientierten Fach hast.  
…du nicht Lust auf Vorlesungen sondern auf digitale Interaktion mit Studierenden hast.  
…du Verantwortung für ein inhaltliches Modul im Studiengang übernehmen kannst.  
…du offen für und neugierig auf Neues und unterschiedliche Perspektiven bist.  
… du bevorzugterweise bereits über Erfahrung in der Hochschullehre verfügst, vielleicht sogar im Distance Learning.  
… du sehr gut sowohl auf Deutsch als auch auf Englisch kommunizieren kannst.  

Was dich bei uns erwartet

Ein kleines, engagiertes Team, das Ideen und dynamischen Weiterentwicklungen in der Lehre Raum gibt.  
Interdisziplinäre Zusammenarbeit unter den Instituten und gemeinschaftliche Teamarbeit mit allen Mitarbeitenden aus Lehre, Verwaltung und Technik.  
Flexible, familienfreundlich gestaltbare Arbeitszeiten (Gleitzeit), Mobile Working - und Rücksichtnahme auf dein Leben außerhalb der Arbeit.  
Kein All-in-Vertrag, keine Überstundenpauschale.  
Ein inklusives, diverses Umfeld 
Büro in Wiener Neustadt mit sehr guter öffentlicher Erreichbarkeit.  

Gehalt
Das Mindestgehalt liegt bei 3.400 EUR brutto pro Monat (auf 39 Stunden Basis), das tatsächliche Gehalt ist abhängig von Qualifikation und Erfahrung. Das Gehalt wird 14-mal jährlich ausbezahlt.  
Diversität & Inklusion sind für uns mehr als nur Worte! 
Wir fühlen uns dafür verantwortlich, die FERNFH als vielfältige und inklusive Organisation weiterzuentwickeln. Wir laden Menschen unterschiedlicher Nationalitäten, Ethnien, Religionen, Altersgruppen, Geschlechter, sexueller Orientierungen und mit oder ohne Behinderungen oder chronischen Erkrankungen dazu ein, sich gemeinsam mit uns für gerechte Bildungschancen einzusetzen.  
Was uns ausmacht - Ferdinand Porsche FERNFH als Arbeitgeberin 
Wir, die Ferdinand Porsche FERNFH; sind die einzige Fern-Fachhochschule Österreichs. Wir begreifen uns als Vorreiterin für innovative Formate und Chancengerechtigkeit in der akademischen Bildung und wollen allen Menschen den Weg zu qualitätvollem und leistbarem Lebenslangem Lernen ermöglichen.  
Als Arbeitgeberin sind wir darauf bedacht moderne technische und strukturelle Methoden mit sozialer Verantwortung zu kombinieren - das Ergebnis: flexible Arbeitsmöglichkeiten, wie Mobile Working oder ein besonderes Augenmerk auf Familienfreundlichkeit. Bei uns sind Karenzrückkehrer*innen herzlich willkommen!

karriere.at7680974.snippet: Your responsibilities: In your new role, Hardware Design and Development: Develop hardware, including schematic and layout design, System Validation and Firmware Support: Support system validation with microcontrollers, Printed...
karriere.at7680974.description:
Internship - System Application Engineer for Power Applications based on Silicon and WBG (GaN/SiC) (f/m/div)
As a global leader in semiconductor solutions in power systems and IoT, Infineon enables game-changing solutions for green and efficient energy, clean and safe mobility, as well as smart and secure IoT. Together, we drive innovation and customer success, while caring for our people and empowering them to reach ambitious goals. Be a part of making life easier, safer and greener. Are you in?  
Key responsibilities in your new role  

Hardware Design and Development: Develop hardware, including schematic and layout design  
System Validation and Firmware Support: Support system validation with microcontrollers, Printed Circuit Boards work, firmware configuration, datalogging and scripting  
PCB Testing: Testing of power Printed Circuit Boards  
Motor Control Validation and Testing: Validate motor control by adjusting inverter settings, performing speed and torque profiles and recording key signals for comparison of competitive analysis and benchmarking  
Market Research: Competitive Analysis and Benchmarking Summaries  
Documentation and Customer Enablement: Document work for customer enablement and create related content  

Further Information
Type of employment: Temporary / Part-time (flexible working hours from Monday to Friday between 6 a.m. and 7 p.m.)
Duration: 12 months  
Qualifications and skills to help you succeed  

Education: Motivated and committed student (f/m/div) from the field of Electrical Engineering, Microelectronics, Computer Sciences or similar  
Knowledge: Solid understanding of motor control applications and inverter topologies (e.g. BLDC/PMSM, three-phase bridge, gate drivers) as well as on Power Switches MOSFETs / GaN (datasheet parameters understanding)  
Technical Skills: Basic knowledge on CAD systems for PCB design like KiCad, Orcad, Altium Designer and simulation tools like LTSpice/Simmetrix as well as peripherals, PWM, ADC, UART and ability to configure evaluation boards under guidance  
Hands-on Experience: Combination of solid hardware knowledge with applied software skills and genuine interest to make yourself familiar with laboratory testing equipment  
Language Skills: Fluent in English, German is a plus  

This position is subject to the collective agreement for workers and employees in the electrical and electronics industry (full-time), employment group B for bachelor students, employment group D for master students (https://www.feei.at/wp-content/uploads/2024/04/minimum-salaries-white-collar-workers-2025.pdf).  
Please attach the following documents (German or English) to your application: 

Motivation letter  
CV  
Certificate of matriculation at a university  
Latest Transcript of records (not older than 6 months)  
Highest completed educational certificate (Matura certificate for Bachelor students, Bachelor certificate for Master students)  
Reference letter (optional)  

Contact:
Ina Miklau  
#WeAreIn for driving decarbonization and digitalization.  As a global leader in semiconductor solutions in power systems and IoT, Infineon enables game-changing solutions for green and efficient energy, clean and safe mobility, as well as smart and secure IoT. Together, we drive innovation and customer success, while caring for our people and empowering them to reach ambitious goals. Be a part of making life easier, safer and greener.  Are you in?   We are on a journey to create the best Infineon for everyone.  This means we embrace diversity and inclusion and welcome everyone for who they are. At Infineon, we offer a working environment characterized by trust, openness, respect and tolerance and are committed to give all applicants and employees equal opportunities. We base our recruiting decisions on the applicant´s experience and skills.  Learn more about our various contact channels.  We look forward to receiving your resume, even if you do not entirely meet all the requirements of the job posting.  Please let your recruiter know if they need to pay special attention to something in order to enable your participation in the interview process.  Click here for more information about Diversity & Inclusion at Infineon.

Noch ein Klick bis zu deinem neuen Job! Bewirb dich online über unser Kandidatenportal - in wenigen Minuten ist alles erledigt.  
Deine zukünftige Rolle
In dieser verantwortungsvollen Funktion bist Du maßgeblich daran beteiligt, die Elektronikarchitektur für unsere hochinnovativen E-Mobilitätslösungen zu gestalten. Du übernimmst die Entwicklung und Optimierung von neuen und bestehenden digitalen und analogen Schaltungen und führst den Elektronikbereich innerhalb von Entwicklungsprojekten fachlich eigenständig - unter Berücksichtigung von Zeit, Kosten und Qualität. Du leitest das Elektronik-Team fachlich, arbeitest eng mit Firmware-, Software- und Mechanik-Kolleg:innen zusammen und bist verantwortlich für Produktfreigaben. Darüber hinaus bringst Du aktiv neue Methoden und Prozessverbesserungen ein, identifizierst Technologien und Lösungen mit Innovationspotenzial und setzt diese um.  
Du bietest

Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Elektronik, Elektrotechnik, Telematik, Mechatronik, Automatisierungstechnik oder vergleichbar  
Mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Entwicklung komplexer mechatronischer Systeme 
Sehr gutes Verständnis elektrischer und funktionaler Sicherheit 
Fundiertes Wissen in EMV-gerechtem Design  
Erfahrung im Layout-Design (gerne Altium Designer)  
Unternehmerisches Denken sowie lösungsorientierte Vorgehensweise  
Ausgeprägte Team- und Kommunikationsfähigkeit  
Selbstständige, systematische sowie eigenverantwortliche Arbeitsweise  
Gute Englischkenntnisse, idealerweise auch Deutschkenntnisse  

Das Besondere an dieser Position
Du erhältst ein ausgesprochen vielseitiges Aufgabengebiet in einer aufstrebenden E-Mobility Umgebung - mit hoher Eigenverantwortung und echten Gestaltungsmöglichkeiten. karriere.at7680989.description:
AI Solutions & Strategy Lead (m/w/d)

DIENSTORT  Kalsdorf bei Graz  
ARBEITSZEIT  Vollzeit (38,5 h /Woche)  

SUPER AUFGABEN

Du leitest den Aufbau und die Weiterentwicklung unserer AI-Strategie (von der Identifikation geeigneter Use Cases bis zur Umsetzung produktiver Lösungen)  
Du übernimmst die technische Verantwortung für die Konzeption, Architektur und Integration von AI-Systemen und LLM-basierten Lösungen (z. B. OpenAI, Azure OpenAI, Copilot-Frameworks).  
Du entwickelst und orchestrierst AI Agents in der Microsoft-Welt (Copilot Studio, Azure AI Studio, Power Platform, Graph API) - mit Fokus auf Sicherheit, Effizienz und Nutzermehrwert  
Du entwickelst AI-Integrationsarchitekturen für interne Systeme (z. B. Dynamics 365, SharePoint, interne Wissensdatenbanken, APIs)  
Du bist im Tagesgeschäft rund um Daten mit verankert und suchst aktiv nach Automatisierungsmöglichkeiten  
Du baust Prototypen und produktive LLM-Anwendungen, z. B. Chatbots, Wissens-Agents, Automatisierungen oder semantische Suchsysteme  
Du evaluierst neue AI-Technologien, Frameworks und Modelle, testest Open-Source- und Cloud-Lösungen (Hugging Face, LangChain, Semantic Kernel, etc.)  
Du arbeitest eng mit IT, Data Engineering, Dynamics Team, Product Ownern, etc., um AI-Projekte von der Vision bis zum Go-Live umzusetzen  
Du unterstützt beim Aufbau einer AI-Governance- und Sicherheitsarchitektur (Prompt Security, Responsible AI, Datenhaltung)  

SUPER VORAUSSETZUNGEN

Du hast eine abgeschlossene Ausbildung im Bereich Informatik, Software Engineering, Data Science oder verwandten Bereichen  
Du bringst mehrjährige Erfahrung im Bereich Machine Learning, Large Language Models oder AI-Systemarchitektur mit und hast Expertise im Aufbau und in der Weiterentwicklung von Agents  
Du verfügst über praktische Erfahrung mit Microsoft AI-Technologien (z. B. Azure OpenAI und AI Search, Copilot Studio, Cognitive Services, Power Automate)  
Du kennst dich aus mit LLM-Orchestrierung und Agent-Frameworks (z. B. LangChain, Semantic Kernel, AutoGen, OpenAI Function Calling)  
Du verstehst Systemarchitekturen, APIs und Datenflüsse und kannst AI-Komponenten sauber in bestehende IT-Landschaften integrieren  
Du bist sicher in mindestens einer Programmiersprache (z. B. Python, C#, TypeScript) und hast Erfahrung mit API-Integration, Prompt Engineering und Vektordatenbanken (z. B. Pinecone, Redis, Azure Vector Search)  
Du arbeitest eigenverantwortlich, strukturiert und lösungsorientiert  
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift  

UNSERE HIGHLIGHTS UND ANGEBOTE FÜR DICH

Dein Rhythmus zählt: Homeoffice sowie Gleitzeitmodell mit kurzen Kernzeiten und 4,5-Tage-Woche  
 Wachse mit uns: Externe Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowie interne Lernplattform zur persönlichen und beruflichen Entwicklung  
 Wohlfühlfaktor Arbeitsplatz: Unterstützung mentaler Gesundheit mit externem Partner, Betriebsarzt, Förderung Bildschirmbrille, ergonomischer Arbeitsplatz & freie Getränke  
 Hier zählt das WIR: Mitarbeiterevents, Teambuildingaktivitäten & Patenprogramm  
 Nachhaltig unterwegs: Bikeleasing und Fahrtkostenzuschuss für deine Arbeitsweg- und Freizeitgestaltung  
 Mehr für Dich: Zukunftssicherung von EUR 300 p.a., zahlreiche Vergünstigungen bei Partnern & Weiterempfehlungsprämie  
 Faires Entgelt: Gehalt ab EUR 52.000,- (38,5 h/ Woche) mit Bereitschaft zur Überzahlung bei entsprechender Erfahrung und Qualifikation  

UNSERE TECHEM BENEFITS

Flexible Arbeitsgestaltung  
Gesundheitsprogramm  
Aus- und Weiterbildungen  
Teamevents- und veranstaltungen  
Fahrtkostenzuschuss  
Bikeleasing  
Ergonomischer Arbeitsplatz  
Vergünstigungen  
Zukunftssicherung  

DEINE ANSPRECHPERSON
Hr. Mag. Lukas Erlacher  Leitung HR & Recht  +43 50623-0

Techem bietet clevere Lösungen für mehr Energieeffizienz in Gebäuden. Wir setzen uns ein - für unsere Kunden und die Umwelt, aktiv und in 18 Ländern weltweit. Innovative und nachhaltige Technologien stehen dabei für uns im Mittelpunkt, um Gebäude green, smart und healthy zu machen - und das sind die Gründe, warum wir jeden Tag gerne zur Arbeit gehen.
